Body: Following the example of 'take' -> 'taker, 'create' -> 'creater' and so on, we might expect that there would exist a noun '*raper' from the verb 'rape'. Instead we have the noun 'rapist'. Is there a term for such non-words that are formed according to the derivation rules of a language but don't exist?
Title: Term for a non-word consistent with derivation rules

OwnerUser.AboutMe: Second-year undergraduate reading Mathematics & Philosophy. Signed up in a fit of procrastination.
